title: Acrocercops euthycolona
text:
Acrocercops euthycolona is a <a href="moth">moth</a> of the family <a href="Gracillariidae">Gracillariidae</a>, known from <a href="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a>, <a href="India">India</a>, as well as <a href="Brunei%20Darussalam">Brunei Darussalam</a>, <a href="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>, <a href="Malaysia">Malaysia</a>, the <a href="Solomon%20Islands">Solomon Islands</a>, <a href="Sri%20Lanka">Sri Lanka</a>, and <a href="Vanuatu">Vanuatu</a>. It was described by <a href="Edward%20Meyrick">Edward Meyrick</a> in 1931.
The hostplants for the species include "<a href="Anacardium%20occidentale">Anacardium occidentale</a>", "<a href="Madhuca%20indica">Madhuca indica</a>", "<a href="Madhuca%20latifolia">Madhuca latifolia</a>", "<a href="Mimusops%20elengi">Mimusops elengi</a>", and "<a href="Mimusops%20elengi">Mimusops elengi</a>". They <a href="leaf%20miner">mine</a> the leaves of their host plant. The mine has the form of a large ovate blotch mine under the upper cuticle of the leaf. It is pinkish, shining and opaque.
